channel.title: Dietary patterns – Seven Countries Study
channel.description: Since 1947. The first major study to look at dietary components and patterns and lifestyle as risk factors for cardiovascular disease, over multiple countries and extended periods of time.

item.title: Four lifestyle factors and all-cause mortality
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: A healthful diet and lifestyle are related to a low all-cause mortality risk A Mediterranean style diet, a high level of physical activity, non-smoking and moderate alcohol consumption were all associated with a low 10-year risk of all-cause mortality in the European HALE project. A very low all-cause mortality risk was observed in elderly [...]

item.title: Dietary patterns and all-cause mortality
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Diets contain nutrients, and these are generally highly correlated with other factors due to the choice of foods in which they occur, but also on the consumption of a particular food at the expense of another one. These factors are taken into account when indicators of dietary patterns are evaluated.

item.title: Mediterranean style diets and cardiovascular disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: The Seven Countries Study showed strong associations between dietary saturated fat and both serum cholesterol and CHD mortality among the 16 cohorts.

item.title: Mediterranean dietary patterns in the 1960s
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: The traditional Mediterranean diet was a nutritionally adequate diet with a varying total fat content, low in saturated fat and very low in trans fat, rich in fiber and antioxidant vitamins or flavonoids.
